paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant p.G601S, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Type 2 Long QT Syndrome (LQT2) with repetitive episodes of syncope

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We performed a genetic analysis for known causative genes of LQTS (2), and the analysis identified KCNH2 p.G601S (c.G1801A) and SCN5A p.V1568M (c.G4702A).

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc prolongation but never experienced syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This variant was also identified in the genomic DNA of the patient's father. The father’s ECG also showed QTc prolongation, but he had never experienced syncope.

functional_data.summary: The variant is reported as pathogenic and associated with LQT2.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family; the father carries the variant but is unaffected.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was treated with bisoprolol and mexiletine, and an ICD was implanted after a baseball competition.
key_quotes: KCNH2 p.G601S is a reported pathogenic variant of LQT2.
The father’s ECG also showed QTc prolongation, but he had never experienced syncope.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 variant was successfully extracted.
